[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rpc_with_fallbacks()] [TimeService manipulation] Does TimeService.clone() create independent time sources, or can time manipulation affect fallback retry logic? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc_raw()] [Raw bytes injection] Can attackers bypass type safety by crafting malicious raw_message bytes that deserialize into unexpected message types? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc_raw()] [Blocking task explosion] Does spawn_blocking properly limit concurrent deserialization tasks, or can flooding raw RPCs exhaust the blocking thread pool? (High)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: send_rb_rpc()] [Type constraint bypass] The generic constraints require TConsensusMsg + RBMessage, but can trait bound manipulation allow non-consensus messages to be sent? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Protocol map manipulation] Can an attacker cause HashMap collisions or manipulate the peer->protocol mapping to send malformed messages to specific validators? (High)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Serialization inconsistency] Can different protocol versions serialize the same message differently, causing non-deterministic consensus behavior? (High)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: ProofNotifier::send_epoch_change()] [Proof ordering] Can epoch change proofs be delivered out of order, causing validators to process epoch N+2 before N+1? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: ProofNotifier::send_commit_proof()] [Commit proof race] Can concurrent commit proofs race with each other, causing validators to commit blocks out of order? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::new()] [Channel buffer sizes] The hardcoded buffer sizes (10, 50, 10) - can these be exhausted during high load causing message drops? (High)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::new()] [NetworkId validation] The panic when NetworkId::Validator is missing - can configuration errors or attacks cause this panic to DoS validators? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::new()] [Stream merging race] Does select_all guarantee fair polling of network streams, or can one stream monopolize processing? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::new()] [Self-receiver priority] The select(network_events, self_receiver) - which stream has priority, and can this be exploited for message ordering attacks? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: push_msg()] [Push error handling] When push fails with error, only a warning is logged - can systematic push failures cause silent message loss? (High)
[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: push_msg()] [Discriminant collision] Can crafted messages have identical discriminants causing channel key conflicts and message overwrites? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: push_msg()] [FIFO ordering violation] Does the push operation guarantee FIFO ordering, or can race conditions cause message reordering within the same channel? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start()] [Event loop termination] If all_events.next() returns None, the loop terminates - can attackers force stream closure to halt consensus message processing? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start()] [Monitor macro overhead] Does the monitor! macro introduce overhead that could be exploited to slow down message processing? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start() - Message handling] [Message type confusion] Can the match on ConsensusMsg variants be bypassed by crafting messages that match multiple patterns? (High)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start() - Quorum store messages] [Channel routing attack] Can attackers manipulate messages to be routed to quorum_store_messages_tx instead of consensus_messages_tx to bypass consensus validation? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start() - CommitVoteMsg handling] [Oneshot channel leak] CommitVoteMsg creates oneshot channel with ignored rx - can repeated CommitVoteMsgs cause channel resource leaks? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start() - CommitDecisionMsg handling] [Decision message injection] Can attackers send CommitDecisionMsg directly to bypass commit vote aggregation and force premature commits? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start() - ProposalMsg handling] [Block stage tracking] The observe_block calls track proposal timing - can timing manipulation be used to identify and target specific proposals? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start() - OptProposalMsg handling] [Optimistic proposal timing] The separate BlockStage::NETWORK_RECEIVED_OPT_PROPOSAL - can this timing channel leak information about validator readiness? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start() - Proposal logging] [Information leakage] The info! logs for proposals include block_hash and round - can this information be used to predict future proposals? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/network.rs] [Function: NetworkTask::start() - RandGenMessage handling] [Random generation bypass] Can attackers send RandGenMessage through direct send path to bypass RPC validation? (High)
